alert.note: Alert for Carter; Fallon (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued November 09 at 8:43AM MST until November 11 at 12:00AM MST by NWS Billings
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO MIDNIGHT MST THURSDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 4 and 7 inches. Winds gusting as high as 30 mph, creating significant blowing and drifting snow. * WHERE...Carter and Fallon. * WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to Midnight MST Thursday Night. * IMPACTS...Roads will likely become slick and hazardous. Visibilities may drop to a half mile or less, due to falling and blowing snow. Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strong northwest winds will cause significant blowing snow, which will dramatically reduce visibility and potentially create large snow drifts.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. Plan any travel carefully. Make sure your vehicle is winterized and in good working order. Consider taking a winter storm kit along with you, including such items as tire chains, booster cables, flashlight, shovel, blankets, and extra clothing.
